events.name: FY2011 Refugee Ceiling (80,000)
events.description: President Obama sets FY2011 refugee ceiling at 80,000, maintaining USRAP capacity.

events.name: FY2012 Refugee Ceiling (76,000)
events.description: FY2012 refugee ceiling set at 76,000 with regional allocations.

events.name: FY2013 Refugee Ceiling (70,000)
events.description: FY2013 refugee ceiling set at 70,000.

events.name: FY2014 Refugee Ceiling (70,000)
events.description: FY2014 refugee ceiling maintained at 70,000.

events.name: FY2015 Refugee Ceiling (70,000)
events.description: FY2015 refugee ceiling maintained at 70,000.

events.name: FY2016 Refugee Ceiling (85,000)
events.description: FY2016 ceiling increased to 85,000 in response to Syrian crisis.

events.name: FY2017 Refugee Ceiling (110,000)
events.description: FY2017 ceiling set at historic high of 110,000 by Obama administration.

events.name: Travel Ban Executive Order 13769
events.description: Initial Travel Ban: 90-day suspension of entry from 7 countries, 120-day suspension of USRAP, 50,000 cap on FY2017 admissions. Blocked by courts Feb 3, 2017.

events.name: Revised Travel Ban Executive Order 13780
events.description: Revised Travel Ban: 90-day suspension from 6 countries (Iraq removed), 120-day USRAP suspension. Partially blocked by courts, upheld by SCOTUS June 2018 (Trump v. Hawaii).

events.name: FY2018 Refugee Ceiling (45,000)
events.description: Historic ceiling reduction from 110,000 to 45,000 (59% cut).

events.name: FY2019 Refugee Ceiling (30,000)
events.description: Further ceiling reduction to 30,000 (33% cut from FY2018).

events.name: State/Local Consent Requirement
events.description: Required state and local written consent for refugee resettlement. North Dakota Governor Burgum provided consent Dec 2019. Order vacated by courts Jan 2020.

events.name: FY2020 Refugee Ceiling (18,000)
events.description: Lowest ceiling in USRAP history (18,000).

events.name: COVID-19 Travel Restrictions
events.description: COVID-19 pandemic leads to embassy closures, suspended USRAP interviews, and global travel restrictions. Near-complete halt to refugee arrivals.

events.name: FY2021 Refugee Ceiling (15,000)
events.description: FY2021 ceiling set at record low 15,000 by outgoing Trump administration.

events.name: LSSND Closure (ND Capacity Shock)
events.primary_source: Lutheran Social Services of North Dakota closure announcement, Dec 2020
events.description: Lutheran Social Services of North Dakota closes after 70+ years, ending primary refugee resettlement capacity. LIRS/Global Refuge assumes ND resettlement with reduced local infrastructure.

events.name: FY2021 Ceiling Raised (62,500)
events.description: Biden administration raises FY2021 ceiling from 15,000 to 62,500 and removes regional allocations. Processing backlog limits actual admissions to ~11,000.

events.name: Operation Allies Welcome (Afghan Parole)
events.primary_source: DHS Operation Allies Welcome, Aug 2021; Afghan Adjustment Act pending
events.description: Emergency Afghan evacuation and parole program following Taliban takeover. ~76,000 Afghans paroled to US with 2-year humanitarian parole status (no automatic path to permanence). ND estimated to receive 50-100 through FY2023.

events.name: FY2022 Refugee Ceiling (125,000)
events.description: Biden sets aspirational ceiling of 125,000 for FY2022. Processing capacity limitations result in ~25,000 actual admissions.

events.name: Uniting for Ukraine (U4U Parole)
events.description: Humanitarian parole program for Ukrainian nationals following Russian invasion. Requires US sponsor. ~200,000+ paroled nationally by end 2024. ND estimated 600-800 arrivals. 2-year parole status with uncertain extension.

events.name: FY2023 Refugee Ceiling (125,000)
events.description: FY2023 ceiling maintained at 125,000; ~60,000 actual admissions.

events.name: CHNV Parole Programs
events.description: Parole programs for Cuban, Haitian, Nicaraguan, and Venezuelan nationals. 30,000/month cap. Minimal impact on ND due to resettlement patterns.

events.name: Welcome Corps (Private Sponsorship)
events.primary_source: State Department Welcome Corps Launch, Jan 2023
events.description: Private refugee sponsorship program launch (5-person groups can sponsor refugee families). Adds capacity outside traditional resettlement agencies. Potential future ND impact unclear.

events.name: FY2024 Refugee Ceiling (125,000)
events.description: FY2024 ceiling maintained at 125,000; ~100,000 actual admissions achieved.

events.name: FY2025 Refugee Ceiling (125,000)
events.description: FY2025 ceiling set at 125,000 by Biden administration. Incoming Trump administration expected to reduce ceiling significantly.
